        }(document, window));
</script>

Really good for larger groups.", "author": "Taylor Z."}, {"reviewRating": {"ratingValue": 5}, "datePublished": "2019-09-04", "description": "We stayed across the street at the W over the holiday weekend, and the hotel restaurant didn't have the laid back feel we were looking for on a Saturday evening. So, we walked over to Thirsty Bear to see what was up. \n\nThirsty Bear has your typical brew pub vibe, with an interesting variety of food options. My man had the tasting flight, while I had my usual old fashioned. We were both happy with our selections. We had the $5 mixed olives as an appetizer, and we received more than we expected. The Thirstyburger was delicious and perfectly prepared. If you do nothing else, order the potatoes \"bravas\" style! It was my first time having patatas and they are quarter-sized potato wedges, and so so so dry I ate maybe 2 out of the whole plate. We like to seek out great beer. Usually new beer spots seem to pop up in industrial areas and set up in an old warehouse space. This brewery was definitely one of the more fancier spots for beer. I suppose because it is San Francisco City, they have to be fancy. Anyway, I digress. Let's get straight to the beer. It is the first brewery certified as organic. Now, I am not sure how you feel about the word organic. I for one am not overly concerned as organic to me implies expensive. But, I also do not like to eat any GMO laced food items, so I was intrigued.\nI digress again!! Let's talk beer. Delicious. For a decent price you could a a flight and try all 10, but I stuck with pints. I have been drawn nitro beers lately. They are much smoother and have a creamy top a little, like drinking dessert. Everything we drank was delicious. \nThe food was, well, fancy San Francisco, so, and expensive. We shared the brussel sprouts appetizer, which was delicious. But due to the prices of the other items, which looked good coming out of the kitchen, we decided to limit our spending here. \nCome for the beer.             'svg'

            d.documentElement.className,
            'icon-svg-unavailable'
        ].join(' ');

    head.appendChild(script);

Consumer Protection Initiative, which is designed to empower and protect consumers.</p&gt;","View reservation history":"View reservation history","Log Out":"Log Out","Tell us what you expected to                     <div itemprop="review" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">
        <meta itemprop="author" content="Mike Z.">
        <div itemprop="reviewRating" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating">
            <meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4.0">
        </div>
        <meta itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-03-28">
        <p itemprop="description">We went there to try it out. It was very quiet at night. But I&#39;m told we caught an off night and it&#39;s usually very busy. Our server was very friendly and helpful. But the food was nothing to write home about it was decent and hot. The beer was really great.

            <div itemprop="review" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">
        <meta itemprop="author" content="Julie S.">
        <div itemprop="reviewRating" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating">
            <meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4.0">
        </div>
        <meta itemprop="datePublished" content="2020-02-05">
        <p itemprop="description">This is so close to our office, we end up here mostly for happy hour when in SF and I had honestly never eaten here. But on my last visit, we needed a place to have a quick-ish lunch. Thanks to being able to make a reservation, we knew we wouldn&#39;t spend any time waiting in line. 

The service was fast and friendly, and the food was surprisingly good. With a big group, we ordered a little bit of everything, but the favorite was the big-enough-to-share paella. The food came out with plenty of time for us to eat leisurely. For me, if I can&#39;t eat slowly and take my time, I&#39;d just rather skip the meal entirely. 

I would absolutely come back here for another lunch or happy hour, and next time I think I&#39;ll do the flatbreads and patatas bravas based on these reviews.<p>
    </div>

            <div itemprop="review" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">
        <meta itemprop="author" content="Mike C.">
        <div itemprop="reviewRating" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating">
            <meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4.0">
        </div>
        <meta itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-11-18">
        <p itemprop="description">Beer is not my thing, though I am perpetually thirsty... hey, what&#39;s the name of this place?!  No small coincidence I guess.

My friend chose this for a summer weekday early dinner after hearing about it from the local PBS restaurant show.  My friends (including me, a party of 3) arrived early and were already seated at a wall table on the right near the front, likely part of the bar area.  They took the liberty of ordering most of our menu already so it was a no brainer for me.

Here is what we shared:

Tapas
1. Empanadas (https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=sSGpOAbIxmsbgdvgRYrMsA&amp;userid=saJuyv784apZzH--psHZ3Q) - Crispy and not oily, these were filled with pulled pork, corn, red peppers, and queso fresco and served with a cilantro crème.  As visually appealing as yummy.

2. Bacon wrapped shrimp (https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=HfPgKRzr0jub02gywafqXQ&amp;userid=saJuyv784apZzH--psHZ3Q) - Each one topped a jalapeno corn cake and came with a herb crème on the side.  Nothing spectacular about this one but still okay.

3. Raclette mac and cheese (https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=_BSwSw1ncVahrBCpF15bzw&amp;userid=saJuyv784apZzH--psHZ3Q) - Rich and creamy as expected, this was made with pasta shells topped with a Raciette béchamel and bread crumbs.  The topping was just crusty enough.  Btw, had to Google the cheese to learn that this is a hard swiss cheese.

4. Potatas bravas (https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=-mSPX1Q5Sam9aGFa37IPEQ&amp;userid=saJuyv784apZzH--psHZ3Q) - This was my add on, fried Kennebec potatoes, garlic, and spicy brava sauce, served with a aioli for dipping.  This was my personal favorite of the night.

5. Beer-braised crispy pork ribs ()https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=Zcuhx0ViyBBfO5uILqaxWw&amp;userid=saJuyv784apZzH--psHZ3Q - Tender pork ribs (inside) with an outer crunch cooked in a house ale and barbecue sauce and served with frisee (gotta have something healthy on the plate) buried underneath.

Regular plates
6. Sausage flatbread (https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=oz_u1mAcvDv6nhKzqp9bxg&amp;userid=saJuyv784apZzH--psHZ3Q) - Very thin crust topped with three sausages (chorizi soria, chorizo, bilbao, and butifarra sausage) with a white bean puree, manchego, and roasted red peppers on top.  Again, it was decent but didn&#39;t wow us.

7. Valenciana paella (https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=daXE-csmAht9VwipJ1kKMA&amp;userid=saJuyv784apZzH--psHZ3Q) - This contained saffron, sofritto, chicken, chorizo, clams, mussels, shrimp, rockfish, roasted red peppers, and peas.  The portions are certainly generous as the ingredients were heaping out of the cast iron pan.  Liked the variety of the seafood.  Only comment is that I wished the bottom rice was more crunchy or stuck to the pan.  Liked using the lemon to offset the heaviness of the flavors.

Service was cordial as the bus staff quickly removed empty plates and refilled drink glasses.  Our waitress was a bit slammed as she was bouncing from large tables to large tables as well as helping with some bar customers.  Still, she checked on us when time allowed and did get my late potatos order in. 

Definitely not a place for someone looking for a light meal as much of the menu is fried, grilled, and heavy on flavors.  Guess you could say that it&#39;s perfect bar food, though I am not a beer or alcohol afficianado... 

While leaving, I happened to notice the mascot (https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=Pu6KWzbKJvx0NuxiGoMSpA&amp;userid=saJuyv784apZzH--psHZ3Q) who I did not see when I arrived.  Attending that school in Berkeley, I just have to say it... &#34;Go Bears!&#34;<p>
    </div>

            <div itemprop="review" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">
        <meta itemprop="author" content="Hazel C.">
        <div itemprop="reviewRating" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating">
            <meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="3.0">
        </div>
        <meta itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-11-06">
        <p itemprop="description">My brother-in-law Jimmy from Washington DC was in town for a case, so we met up with him here at Thirsty Bear. He is a beer enthusiast, so we had to get together at a brewery. We needed a place near his hotel in the FiDi that also served food, so this place fit the bill. 

Jimmy and Michael had beer, but I&#39;m not a beer drinker so I had the Cava on the drinks menu. Our drinks came promptly, which were great, but our food came very late, at least 40 minutes after we ordered. Our server was nowhere to be found, so we had to wait a while to order more drinks and ask about our food&#39;s ETA. I understand that it was Friday around 5 pm and they&#39;re inundated by the after work crowd, but the food took too long. Our server did apologize for the backup in the kitchen, but I wish he had stopped by earlier to let us know.

Jimmy ordered the Chorizo Flatbread and Michael ordered the ThirstyBurger. Both were happy with their food, but I was underwhelmed by my order of PEI Mussels in a Green Curry sauce. The mussels were really small and the green curry too mild. Very unsatisfying. I definitely did not order the right thing. The flatbread looked good. 

ThirstyBear is a huge place, so it&#39;s great for big groups. If I were in the area thirsty for beer, I might go in but that&#39;s all I&#39;d have. I&#39;ll save my appetite and money for tastier food elsewhere.<p>
    </div>

            <div itemprop="review" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">
        <meta itemprop="author" content="Shachar Y.">

        <meta itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-11-15">
        <p itemprop="description">Came for a few drinks after company diner near by and I love this place. 

Great Bar atmosphere (a little too bright but still ok), great relaxing music in the background(90&#39;s some of my favorite) 

Place is clean and everyone around are smiling and happy. Got set right away and the server was there to ask for a drinks with a great smile. 

I love that they got their own beer and the food menu just compliments the drinks they offer. If I was not full from the dinner we just had, I am sure half the menu was on our table :) 

There intimate sitting and group sitting so this really helps to have this place cater for everyone.

Make sure you bring your ID because no matter how old you look they will still check - I agree with that. 

Come 1 come 2 come as a group - it is worth it.<p>
    </div>

        <meta itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-11-04">
        <p itemprop="description">Good selection of various beers but their sangria is definitely a must try! 

Seating is plentiful and can accommodate large groups during busy happy hour periods, so it&#39;s perfect if you and your workmates need a good place to go to that isn&#39;t packed like most bars in FiDi.

Food menu has your typical bar bites. I tried the Patatas Bravas and wasn&#39;t too impressed. The sauce and toppings were somewhat randomly tossed in with the diced potatoes and it wasn&#39;t the most flavorful. I&#39;m curious to see how the other food items on the menu are though.

Beer selection offers a good variety. I especially enjoyed the Witbier: light and easy finish.

Definitely check this place out if you want drinks at a not too crowded venue.<p>
    </div>

        <p itemprop="description">Stopped in for a brew after visiting MOMA, which I&#39;m sure is how many people end up here. We didn&#39;t have anything to eat (we had reservations at Benu later that night), but a brew was just what the doctor ordered after a long afternoon museum-ing. 

The service was attentive and friendly, despite it being a busy Saturday afternoon. We tried the Chowdah and the Howard Street IPAs--neither of which I would come back for. It&#39;s...fine. Nothing really to write home about, but not bad. In a time where there are so many craft breweries doing so many amazing things, I don&#39;t think Thirsty Bear will be a go-to for me. Maybe it&#39;s because it&#39;s organic? Maybe my brain needs the chemicals. 

Overall, not a bad spot to pop in for a drink if you&#39;re in the area.<p>

        <p itemprop="description">TIMING:

FOOD:

         - Potatoes: bigger than bite size
         - Sauce: spicy but with a tang
         - Meat: no meat was harmed in the making of this dish
         - Aioli: waiter: &#34;FULL of butter&#34;
         - Portion: large enough to share between 3 people

    2. Seafood Paella
         - Texture - Rice: a little hard but soft on the outside
         - Texture - Chicken: very juicy but only a few pieces
         - Meat: muscles were really small, few shrimp and chicken
         - Seasoning: could&#39;ve had a little more pepper
         * Note: &#34;hot&#34;

SERVICE
   - Rude 
         - the waiter laughed at us as soon as we sat down. He then came back 2 minutes later and asked us if we were ready and we said no and he laughed again. We asked if we could get waters, and he glared at us for not getting beer. My friend ended up getting sangria so I think he calmed down.
   - Rushed 
         - we sat there and talked but he came by around 4 times asking to take our food away and brought the bill but never to refill our water

WOULD RECOMMEND?
   - No. If you are looking for a quiet place to catch up with a friend
   - Yes. If you are looking for a spot for large parties, beer and food<p>

            <div itemprop="review" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">
        <meta itemprop="author" content="Amanda V.">
        <div itemprop="reviewRating" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating">
            <meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="5.0">
        </div>
        <meta itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-09-04">
        <p itemprop="description">We stayed across the street at the W over the holiday weekend, and the hotel restaurant didn&#39;t have the laid back feel we were looking for on a Saturday evening. So, we walked over to Thirsty Bear to see what was up. 

Thirsty Bear has your typical brew pub vibe, with an interesting variety of food options. My man had the tasting flight, while I had my usual old fashioned. We were both happy with our selections. We had the $5 mixed olives as an appetizer, and we received more than we expected. The Thirstyburger was delicious and perfectly prepared. If you do nothing else, order the potatoes &#34;bravas&#34; style! Garlic and parmesan cheese, with the right touch of ketchup.  

If we had been in town for longer, we definitely would have eaten at Thirsty Bear again.<p>
    </div>

        <p itemprop="description">Convenient location next to SFMoMa and came here with my office for a late lunch. Great service, although would not come back for the food.

            <div itemprop="review" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">
        <meta itemprop="author" content="Nic Z.">

        <meta itemprop="datePublished" content="2018-12-17">
        <p itemprop="description">We came to Thirsty Bear for lunch as a large group of hungry folks.

--- butter lettuce salad with chicken was so bland<p>
    </div>

            <div itemprop="review" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Review">
        <meta itemprop="author" content="Kathryn Y.">
        <div itemprop="reviewRating" itemscope itemtype="http://schema.org/Rating">
            <meta itemprop="ratingValue" content="4.0">
        </div>
        <meta itemprop="datePublished" content="2019-12-27">
        <p itemprop="description">I am so happy we made this a spot for our day visiting the city. We like to seek out great beer. Usually new beer spots seem to pop up in industrial areas and set up in an old warehouse space. This brewery was definitely one of the more fancier spots for beer. I suppose because it is San Francisco City, they have to be fancy. Anyway, I digress. Let&#39;s get straight to the beer. It is the first brewery certified as organic. Now, I am not sure how you feel about the word organic. I for one am not overly concerned as organic to me implies expensive. But, I also do not like to eat any GMO laced food items, so I was intrigued.
I digress again!! Let&#39;s talk beer. Delicious. For a decent price you could a a flight and try all 10, but I stuck with pints. I have been drawn nitro beers lately. They are much smoother and have a creamy top a little, like drinking dessert. Everything we drank was delicious. 
The food was, well, fancy San Francisco, so, and expensive. We shared the brussel sprouts appetizer, which was delicious. But due to the prices of the other items, which looked good coming out of the kitchen, we decided to limit our spending here. 
Come for the beer. Cheers.<p>
    </div>


    </div>

    </div>

    <div class="content-container js-biz-details">

    </div>

class="lemon--p__373c0__3Qnnj text__373c0__2Kxyz comment__373c0__3EKjH text-color--normal__373c0__3xep9 text-align--left__373c0__2XGa-"><span class="lemon--span__373c0__3997G raw__373c0__3rKqk" lang="en">This is so close to our office, we end up here mostly for happy hour when in SF and I had honestly never eaten here. But on my last visit, we needed a place to have a quick-ish lunch. Thanks to being able to make a reservation, we knew we wouldn&#39;t spend any time waiting in line. <br><br>The service was fast and friendly, and the food was surprisingly good. With a big group, we ordered a little bit of everything, but the favorite was the big-enough-to-share paella. The food came out with plenty of time for us to eat leisurely. For me, if I can&#39;t eat slowly and take my time, I&#39;d just rather skip the meal entirely. <br><br>I would absolutely come back here for another lunch or happy hour, and next time I think I&#39;ll do the flatbreads and patatas bravas based on these reviews.</span></p></div><div class="lemon--div__373c0__1mboc margin-t3__373c0__1l90z margin-b2__373c0__abANL display--inline-block__373c0__1ZKqC margin-r2__373c0__1MwD- margin-b0-5__373c0__Fo75u border-color--default__373c0__3-ifU"><span class="lemon--span__373c0__3997G text__373c0__2Kxyz text-color--mid__373c0__jCeOG text-align--left__373c0__2XGa- text-size--small__373c0__3NVWO"><span class="lemon--span__373c0__3997G display--inline__373c0__3JqBP border-color--default__373c0__3-ifU"><span class="lemon--span__373c0__3997G icon__373c0__ehCWV icon--16-check-in-v2 icon--v2__373c0__1yp8c" aria-hidden="true" style="width:16px;height:16px;fill:#0077bc"><svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" width="16" height="16" viewBox="0 0 16 16" class="icon_svg"><path d="M7.92 14.88a.93.93 0 0 1-.57-.19L6 13.76H4.43a1 .58-.19h1.2l.29-1.16c.068-.2.193-.373.36-.5l1-.72L12 8.22a1 1 0 0 1 0-.61l.35-1.15-1-.7a1.11 1.11 0 0 1-.35-.49l-.38-1.15H9.4a1 1 0 0 1-.57-.19l-1-.69-.96.76a1 1 0 0 1-.58.19H5.08l-.36 1.12a1 1 0 0 1-.36.5l-1 .72.38 1.14c.06.2.06.41 0 .61l-.33 1.15 1 .71a.93.93 0 0 1 .36.49l.39 1.14 1.19-.01zm.85-1.35a1 1 0 0 1-.71-.29L5.42 9.05a1 1 0 0 1 1.41-1.41L7.2 8l1.72-1.73a1 1 0 0 1 1.41 1.42L7.9 10.12a1 1 0 0 1-.7.29z"/></svg></span> <!-- -->1 check-in</span></span></div></div><div class="lemon--div__373c0__1mboc margin-b2__373c0__abANL border-color--default__373c0__3-ifU"><p class="lemon--p__373c0__3Qnnj text__373c0__2Kxyz comment__373c0__3EKjH text-color--normal__373c0__3xep9 text-align--left__373c0__2XGa-"><span class="lemon--span__373c0__3997G raw__373c0__3rKqk" lang="en">Beer is not my thing, though I am perpetually thirsty... hey, what&#39;s the name of this place?!  No small coincidence I guess.<br><br>My friend chose this for a summer weekday early dinner after hearing about it from the local PBS restaurant show.  My friends (including me, a party of 3) arrived early and were already seated at a wall table on the right near the front, likely part of the bar area.  They took the liberty of ordering most of our menu already so it was a no brainer for me.<br><br>Here is what we shared:<br><br>Tapas<br>1. Empanadas (<a href="https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=sSGpOAbIxmsbgdvgRYrMsA&amp;userid=saJuyv784apZzH--psHZ3Q">yelp.com/user_local_phot…</a>) - Crispy and not oily, these were filled with pulled pork, corn, red peppers, and queso fresco and served with a cilantro crème.  As visually appealing as yummy.<br><br>2. Bacon wrapped shrimp (<a href="https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=HfPgKRzr0jub02gywafqXQ&amp;userid=saJuyv784apZzH--psHZ3Q">yelp.com/user_local_phot…</a>) - Each one topped a jalapeno corn cake and came with a herb crème on the side.  Nothing spectacular about this one but still okay.<br><br>3. Raclette mac and cheese (<a href="https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=_BSwSw1ncVahrBCpF15bzw&amp;userid=saJuyv784apZzH--psHZ3Q">yelp.com/user_local_phot…</a>) - Rich and creamy as expected, this was made with pasta shells topped with a Raciette béchamel and bread crumbs.  The topping was just crusty enough.  Btw, had to Google the cheese to learn that this is a hard swiss cheese.<br><br>4. Potatas bravas (<a href="https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=-mSPX1Q5Sam9aGFa37IPEQ&amp;userid=saJuyv784apZzH--psHZ3Q">yelp.com/user_local_phot…</a>) - This was my add on, fried Kennebec potatoes, garlic, and spicy brava sauce, served with a aioli for dipping.  This was my personal favorite of the night.<br><br>5. Beer-braised crispy pork ribs ()<a href="https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=Zcuhx0ViyBBfO5uILqaxWw&amp;userid=saJuyv784apZzH--psHZ3Q">yelp.com/user_local_phot…</a> - Tender pork ribs (inside) with an outer crunch cooked in a house ale and barbecue sauce and served with frisee (gotta have something healthy on the plate) buried underneath.<br><br>Regular plates<br>6. Sausage flatbread (<a href="https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=oz_u1mAcvDv6nhKzqp9bxg&amp;userid=saJuyv784apZzH--psHZ3Q">yelp.com/user_local_phot…</a>) - Very thin crust topped with three sausages (chorizi soria, chorizo, bilbao, and butifarra sausage) with a white bean puree, manchego, and roasted red peppers on top.  Again, it was decent but didn&#39;t wow us.<br><br>7. Valenciana paella (<a href="https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=daXE-csmAht9VwipJ1kKMA&amp;userid=saJuyv784apZzH--psHZ3Q">yelp.com/user_local_phot…</a>) - This contained saffron, sofritto, chicken, chorizo, clams, mussels, shrimp, rockfish, roasted red peppers, and peas.  The portions are certainly generous as the ingredients were heaping out of the cast iron pan.  Liked the variety of the seafood.  Only comment is that I wished the bottom rice was more crunchy or stuck to the pan.  Liked using the lemon to offset the heaviness of the flavors.<br><br>Service was cordial as the bus staff quickly removed empty plates and refilled drink glasses.  Our waitress was a bit slammed as she was bouncing from large tables to large tables as well as helping with some bar customers.  Still, she checked on us when time allowed and did get my late potatos order in. <br><br>Definitely not a place for someone looking for a light meal as much of the menu is fried, grilled, and heavy on flavors.  Guess you could say that it&#39;s perfect bar food, though I am not a beer or alcohol afficianado... <br><br>While leaving, I happened to notice the mascot (<a href="https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=Pu6KWzbKJvx0NuxiGoMSpA&amp;userid=saJuyv784apZzH--psHZ3Q">yelp.com/user_local_phot…</a>) who I did not see when I arrived.  Attending that school in Berkeley, I just have to say it... &#34;Go Bears!&#34;</span></p></div><div class="lemon--div__373c0__1mboc margin-t3__373c0__1l90z margin-b2__373c0__abANL border-color--default__373c0__3-ifU"><div class="lemon--div__373c0__1mboc photo-box-grid__373c0__1C3ha border-color--default__373c0__3-ifU"><span class="lemon--span__373c0__3997G photo-box-grid-item__373c0__2kFqV display--inline__373c0__3JqBP border-color--default__373c0__3-ifU"><div class="lemon--div__373c0__1mboc on-click-container border-color--default__373c0__3-ifU"><a class="lemon--a__373c0__IEZFH link__373c0__1G70M 1 0 0 1-.7.29z"/></svg></span> <!-- -->1 check-in</span></span></div></div><div class="lemon--div__373c0__1mboc margin-b2__373c0__abANL border-color--default__373c0__3-ifU"><p class="lemon--p__373c0__3Qnnj text__373c0__2Kxyz comment__373c0__3EKjH text-color--normal__373c0__3xep9 text-align--left__373c0__2XGa-"><span class="lemon--span__373c0__3997G raw__373c0__3rKqk" lang="en">My brother-in-law Jimmy from Washington DC was in town for a case, so we met up with him here at Thirsty Bear. He is a beer enthusiast, so we had to get together at a brewery. We needed a place near his hotel in the FiDi that also served food, so this place fit the bill. <br><br>Jimmy and Michael had beer, but I&#39;m not a beer drinker so I had the Cava on the drinks menu. Our drinks came promptly, which were great, but our food came very late, at least 40 minutes after we ordered. Our server was nowhere to be found, so we had to wait a while to order more drinks and ask about our food&#39;s ETA. I understand that it was Friday around 5 pm and they&#39;re inundated by the after work crowd, but the food took too long. Our server did apologize for the backup in the kitchen, but I wish he had stopped by earlier to let us know.<br><br>Jimmy ordered the Chorizo Flatbread and Michael ordered the ThirstyBurger. Both were happy with their food, but I was underwhelmed by my order of PEI Mussels in a Green Curry sauce. The mussels were really small and the green curry too mild. Very unsatisfying. I definitely did not order the right thing. The flatbread looked good. <br><br>ThirstyBear is a huge place, so it&#39;s great for big groups. If I were in the area thirsty for beer, I might go in but that&#39;s all I&#39;d have. I&#39;ll save my appetite and money for tastier food elsewhere.</span></p></div><div class="lemon--div__373c0__1mboc margin-t3__373c0__1l90z margin-b2__373c0__abANL border-color--default__373c0__3-ifU"><div class="lemon--div__373c0__1mboc photo-box-grid__373c0__1C3ha border-color--default__373c0__3-ifU"><span class="lemon--span__373c0__3997G photo-box-grid-item__373c0__2kFqV display--inline__373c0__3JqBP border-color--default__373c0__3-ifU"><div class="lemon--div__373c0__1mboc on-click-container border-color--default__373c0__3-ifU"><a class="lemon--a__373c0__IEZFH link__373c0__1G70M photo-box-link__373c0__1YC9Y link-color--blue-dark__373c0__85-Nu link-size--default__373c0__7tls6" href="/biz_photos/thirsty-bear-brewing-company-san-francisco-5?reviewid=0ijZ4zrApX7_yx04n1cgag&amp;select=ZzRtO0qRFNB9sab7kL8ctA" target="" name="" rel=""><img class="lemon--img__373c0__3GQUb photo-box-img__373c0__35y5v" src="https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/ZzRtO0qRFNB9sab7kL8ctA/348s.jpg" alt="Photo of Thirsty Bear Brewing Company - San Francisco, CA, United States. class="lemon--p__373c0__3Qnnj text__373c0__2Kxyz comment__373c0__3EKjH text-color--normal__373c0__3xep9 text-align--left__373c0__2XGa-"><span class="lemon--span__373c0__3997G raw__373c0__3rKqk" lang="en">Good selection of various beers but their sangria is definitely a must try! <br><br>Seating is plentiful and can accommodate large groups during busy happy hour periods, so it&#39;s perfect if you and your workmates need a good place to go to that isn&#39;t packed like most bars in FiDi.<br><br>Food menu has your typical bar bites. I tried the Patatas Bravas and wasn&#39;t too impressed. The sauce and toppings were somewhat randomly tossed in with the diced potatoes and it wasn&#39;t the most flavorful. I&#39;m curious to see how the other food items on the menu are though.<br><br>Beer selection offers a good variety. I especially enjoyed the Witbier: light and easy finish.<br><br>Definitely check this place out if you want drinks at a not too crowded venue.</span></p></div><div class="lemon--div__373c0__1mboc margin-t3__373c0__1l90z margin-b2__373c0__abANL border-color--default__373c0__3-ifU"><div class="lemon--div__373c0__1mboc photo-box-grid__373c0__1C3ha border-color--default__373c0__3-ifU"><span class="lemon--span__373c0__3997G photo-box-grid-item__373c0__2kFqV display--inline__373c0__3JqBP border-color--default__373c0__3-ifU"><div class="lemon--div__373c0__1mboc on-click-container border-color--default__373c0__3-ifU"><a class="lemon--a__373c0__IEZFH link__373c0__1G70M photo-box-link__373c0__1YC9Y link-color--blue-dark__373c0__85-Nu link-size--default__373c0__7tls6" href="/biz_photos/thirsty-bear-brewing-company-san-francisco-5?reviewid=SpZdDIYfgri9LrfQfb1KDQ&amp;select=zc1TmJxEr0rquaY7q584_g" target="" name="" rel=""><img class="lemon--img__373c0__3GQUb photo-box-img__373c0__35y5v" src="https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/zc1TmJxEr0rquaY7q584_g/348s.jpg" alt="Photo of Thirsty Bear Brewing Company - San Francisco, CA, United States. class="lemon--p__373c0__3Qnnj text__373c0__2Kxyz comment__373c0__3EKjH text-color--normal__373c0__3xep9 text-align--left__373c0__2XGa-"><span class="lemon--span__373c0__3997G raw__373c0__3rKqk" lang="en">Stopped in for a brew after visiting MOMA, which I&#39;m sure is how many people end up here. We didn&#39;t have anything to eat (we had reservations at Benu later that night), but a brew was just what the doctor ordered after a long afternoon museum-ing. <br><br>The service was attentive and friendly, despite it being a busy Saturday afternoon. We tried the Chowdah and the Howard Street IPAs--neither of which I would come back for. It&#39;s...fine. Nothing really to write home about, but not bad. In a time where there are so many craft breweries doing so many amazing things, I don&#39;t think Thirsty Bear will be a go-to for me. Maybe it&#39;s because it&#39;s organic? Maybe my brain needs the chemicals. <br><br>Overall, not a bad spot to pop in for a drink if you&#39;re in the area.</span></p></div><div class="lemon--div__373c0__1mboc arrange__373c0__2C9bH text-align--left__373c0__2XGa-"><span class="lemon--span__373c0__3997G raw__373c0__3rKqk" lang="en">TIMING:<br>   - Mild for dinner on a Wednesday night at 5pm<br><br>FOOD:<br>    1. Patata tapa with aioli on the side<br>         - Texture: crunchy!<br>         - Potatoes: bigger than bite size<br>         - Sauce: spicy but with a tang<br>         - Meat: no meat was harmed in the making of this dish<br>         - Aioli: waiter: &#34;FULL of butter&#34;<br>         - Portion: large enough to share between 3 people<br><br>    2. Seafood Paella<br>         - Texture - Rice: a little hard but soft on the outside<br>         - Texture - Chicken: very juicy but only a few pieces<br>         - Meat: muscles were really small, few shrimp and chicken<br>         - Seasoning: could&#39;ve had a little more pepper<br>         * Note: &#34;hot&#34;<br><br>SERVICE<br>   - Rude <br>         - the waiter laughed at us as soon as we sat down. He then came back 2 minutes later and asked us if we were ready and we said no and he laughed again. We asked if we could get waters, and he glared at us for not getting beer. My friend ended up getting sangria so I think he calmed down.<br>   - Rushed <br>         - we sat there and talked but he came by around 4 times asking to take our food away and brought the bill but never to refill our water<br><br>WOULD RECOMMEND?<br>   - No. If you are looking for a quiet place to catch up with a friend<br>   - Yes. margin-b2__373c0__abANL border-color--default__373c0__3-ifU"><p class="lemon--p__373c0__3Qnnj text__373c0__2Kxyz comment__373c0__3EKjH text-color--normal__373c0__3xep9 text-align--left__373c0__2XGa-"><span class="lemon--span__373c0__3997G raw__373c0__3rKqk" lang="en">We stayed across the street at the W over the holiday weekend, and the hotel restaurant didn&#39;t have the laid back feel we were looking for on a Saturday evening. So, we walked over to Thirsty Bear to see what was up. <br><br>Thirsty Bear has your typical brew pub vibe, with an interesting variety of food options. My man had the tasting flight, while I had my usual old fashioned. We were both happy with our selections. We had the $5 mixed olives as an appetizer, and we received more than we expected. The Thirstyburger was delicious and perfectly prepared. If you do nothing else, order the potatoes &#34;bravas&#34; style! Garlic and parmesan cheese, with the right touch of ketchup.  <br><br>If we had been in town for longer, we definitely would have eaten at Thirsty Bear again.</span></p></div><div class="lemon--div__373c0__1mboc margin-t3__373c0__1l90z margin-b2__373c0__abANL border-color--default__373c0__3-ifU"><div class="lemon--div__373c0__1mboc photo-box-grid__373c0__1C3ha border-color--default__373c0__3-ifU"><span class="lemon--span__373c0__3997G photo-box-grid-item__373c0__2kFqV display--inline__373c0__3JqBP border-color--default__373c0__3-ifU"><div class="lemon--div__373c0__1mboc on-click-container border-color--default__373c0__3-ifU"><a class="lemon--a__373c0__IEZFH link__373c0__1G70M photo-box-link__373c0__1YC9Y link-color--blue-dark__373c0__85-Nu link-size--default__373c0__7tls6" href="/biz_photos/thirsty-bear-brewing-company-san-francisco-5?reviewid=EhXOu9FagWFPSDJVUfX_mw&amp;select=VNW9tF1vkkgEQ4-7OlPUdQ" target="" name="" rel=""><img class="lemon--img__373c0__3GQUb photo-box-img__373c0__35y5v" src="https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/VNW9tF1vkkgEQ4-7OlPUdQ/168s.jpg" alt="Photo of Thirsty Bear Brewing Company - San Francisco, CA, United States. class="lemon--p__373c0__3Qnnj text__373c0__2Kxyz comment__373c0__3EKjH text-color--normal__373c0__3xep9 text-align--left__373c0__2XGa-"><span class="lemon--span__373c0__3997G raw__373c0__3rKqk" lang="en">Convenient location next to SFMoMa and came here with my office for a late lunch. Great service, although would not come back for the food.  <br><br>I ordered the Thirsty Burger ($16) and added jalapenos for $1 and comes with a side of patatas. It was my first time having patatas and they are quarter-sized potato wedges, and so so so dry I ate maybe 2 out of the whole plate. The medium ordered burger patty was a little dry, so I doused each bite in hot sauce. Size and taste of the burger is not worth the price.</span></p></div><div class="lemon--div__373c0__1mboc margin-t3__373c0__1l90z margin-b2__373c0__abANL border-color--default__373c0__3-ifU"><div class="lemon--div__373c0__1mboc photo-box-grid__373c0__1C3ha border-color--default__373c0__3-ifU"><span class="lemon--span__373c0__3997G photo-box-grid-item__373c0__2kFqV display--inline__373c0__3JqBP border-color--default__373c0__3-ifU"><div class="lemon--div__373c0__1mboc on-click-container border-color--default__373c0__3-ifU"><a class="lemon--a__373c0__IEZFH link__373c0__1G70M photo-box-link__373c0__1YC9Y link-color--blue-dark__373c0__85-Nu link-size--default__373c0__7tls6" href="/biz_photos/thirsty-bear-brewing-company-san-francisco-5?reviewid=dQWpQ6cBUQ_1uJUDP3jV4g&amp;select=BcTAcA60cWNc2rwsChZ49g" target="" name="" rel=""><img class="lemon--img__373c0__3GQUb photo-box-img__373c0__35y5v" src="https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/BcTAcA60cWNc2rwsChZ49g/348s.jpg" alt="Photo of Thirsty Bear Brewing Company - San Francisco, CA, United States. border-color--default__373c0__3-ifU"><p class="lemon--p__373c0__3Qnnj text__373c0__2Kxyz comment__373c0__3EKjH text-color--normal__373c0__3xep9 text-align--left__373c0__2XGa-"><span class="lemon--span__373c0__3997G raw__373c0__3rKqk" lang="en">I am so happy we made this a spot for our day visiting the city. We like to seek out great beer. Usually new beer spots seem to pop up in industrial areas and set up in an old warehouse space. This brewery was definitely one of the more fancier spots for beer. I suppose because it is San Francisco City, they have to be fancy. Anyway, I digress. Let&#39;s get straight to the beer. It is the first brewery certified as organic. Now, I am not sure how you feel about the word organic. I for one am not overly concerned as organic to me implies expensive. But, I also do not like to eat any GMO laced food items, so I was intrigued.<br>I digress again!! Let&#39;s talk beer. Delicious. For a decent price you could a a flight and try all 10, but I stuck with pints. I have been drawn nitro beers lately. They are much smoother and have a creamy top a little, like drinking dessert. Everything we drank was delicious. <br>The food was, well, fancy San Francisco, so, and expensive. We shared the brussel sprouts appetizer, which was delicious. But due to the prices of the other items, which looked good coming out of the kitchen, we decided to limit our spending here. <br>Come for the beer. Cheers.</span></p></div><div class="lemon--div__373c0__1mboc margin-t3__373c0__1l90z margin-b2__373c0__abANL border-color--default__373c0__3-ifU"><div class="lemon--div__373c0__1mboc photo-box-grid__373c0__1C3ha border-color--default__373c0__3-ifU"><span class="lemon--span__373c0__3997G photo-box-grid-item__373c0__2kFqV display--inline__373c0__3JqBP border-color--default__373c0__3-ifU"><div class="lemon--div__373c0__1mboc on-click-container border-color--default__373c0__3-ifU"><a class="lemon--a__373c0__IEZFH link__373c0__1G70M photo-box-link__373c0__1YC9Y link-color--blue-dark__373c0__85-Nu link-size--default__373c0__7tls6" href="/biz_photos/thirsty-bear-brewing-company-san-francisco-5?reviewid=XndkyJFRt5uKp-5iQYMRaQ&amp;select=hBCTZ83hIUhCLRwZM585iA" target="" name="" rel=""><img class="lemon--img__373c0__3GQUb photo-box-img__373c0__35y5v" src="https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/hBCTZ83hIUhCLRwZM585iA/348s.jpg" alt="Photo of Thirsty Bear Brewing Company - San Francisco, CA, United States. We offer ales, lagers, sours, cask-conditioned, and barrel-aged beers, paired with Spanish and California inspired small plates, empanadas, paella, flatbreads and burgers. Although Ron had won some great cases that helped many people, he wanted to leave billable hours behind and create a social environment in which people could come together and enjoy good beer with good food. Ron had enjoyed tapas and beer countless times while living in Spain in the mid-80s, and those experiences were the seeds for ThirstyBear. His commitment to the environment and a sustainable future has led him to make ThirstyBear the first and only certified organic brewery in San Francisco as well as the first and only what&amp;#39;s the name of this place?!  No small coincidence I guess.<br&gt;<br&gt;My friend chose this for a summer weekday early dinner after hearing about it from the local PBS restaurant show.  My friends (including me, a party of 3) arrived early and were already seated at a wall table on the right near the front, likely part of the bar area.  They took the liberty of ordering most of our menu already so it was a no brainer for me.<br&gt;<br&gt;Here is what we shared:<br&gt;<br&gt;Tapas<br&gt;1. Empanadas (<a href=\"https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=sSGpOAbIxmsbgdvgRYrMsA&amp;amp;userid=saJuyv784apZzH--psHZ3Q\"&gt;yelp.com/user_local_phot…</a&gt;) - Crispy and not oily, these were filled with pulled pork, corn, red peppers, and queso fresco and served with a cilantro crème.  As visually appealing as yummy.<br&gt;<br&gt;2. Bacon wrapped shrimp (<a href=\"https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=HfPgKRzr0jub02gywafqXQ&amp;amp;userid=saJuyv784apZzH--psHZ3Q\"&gt;yelp.com/user_local_phot…</a&gt;) - Each one topped a jalapeno corn cake and came with a herb crème on the side.  Nothing spectacular about this one but still okay.<br&gt;<br&gt;3. Raclette mac and cheese (<a href=\"https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=_BSwSw1ncVahrBCpF15bzw&amp;amp;userid=saJuyv784apZzH--psHZ3Q\"&gt;yelp.com/user_local_phot…</a&gt;) - Rich and creamy as expected, this was made with pasta shells topped with a Raciette béchamel and bread crumbs.  The topping was just crusty enough.  Btw, had to Google the cheese to learn that this is a hard swiss cheese.<br&gt;<br&gt;4. Potatas bravas (<a href=\"https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=-mSPX1Q5Sam9aGFa37IPEQ&amp;amp;userid=saJuyv784apZzH--psHZ3Q\"&gt;yelp.com/user_local_phot…</a&gt;) - This was my add on, fried Kennebec potatoes, garlic, and spicy brava sauce, served with a aioli for dipping.  This was my personal favorite of the night.<br&gt;<br&gt;5. Beer-braised crispy pork ribs ()<a href=\"https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=Zcuhx0ViyBBfO5uILqaxWw&amp;amp;userid=saJuyv784apZzH--psHZ3Q\"&gt;yelp.com/user_local_phot…</a&gt; - Tender pork ribs (inside) with an outer crunch cooked in a house ale and barbecue sauce and served with frisee (gotta have something healthy on the plate) buried underneath.<br&gt;<br&gt;Regular plates<br&gt;6. Sausage flatbread (<a href=\"https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=oz_u1mAcvDv6nhKzqp9bxg&amp;amp;userid=saJuyv784apZzH--psHZ3Q\"&gt;yelp.com/user_local_phot…</a&gt;) - Very thin crust topped with three sausages (chorizi soria, chorizo, bilbao, and butifarra sausage) with a white bean puree, manchego, and roasted red peppers on top.  Again, it was decent but didn&amp;#39;t wow us.<br&gt;<br&gt;7. Valenciana paella (<a href=\"https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=daXE-csmAht9VwipJ1kKMA&amp;amp;userid=saJuyv784apZzH--psHZ3Q\"&gt;yelp.com/user_local_phot…</a&gt;) - This contained saffron, sofritto, chicken, chorizo, clams, mussels, shrimp, rockfish, roasted red peppers, and peas.  The portions are certainly generous as the ingredients were heaping out of the cast iron pan.  Liked the variety of the seafood.  Only comment is that I wished the bottom rice was more crunchy or stuck to the pan.  Liked using the lemon to offset the heaviness of the flavors.<br&gt;<br&gt;Service was cordial as the bus staff quickly removed empty plates and refilled drink glasses.  Our waitress was a bit slammed as she was bouncing from large tables to large tables as well as helping with some bar customers.  Still, she checked on us when time allowed and did get my late potatos order in. <br&gt;<br&gt;Definitely not a place for someone looking for a light meal as much of the menu is fried, grilled, and heavy on flavors.  Guess you could say that it&amp;#39;s perfect bar food, though I am not a beer or alcohol afficianado... <br&gt;<br&gt;While leaving, I happened to notice the mascot (<a href=\"https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=Pu6KWzbKJvx0NuxiGoMSpA&amp;amp;userid=saJuyv784apZzH--psHZ3Q\"&gt;yelp.com/user_local_phot…</a&gt;) who I did not see when I arrived.  Attending that school in Berkeley, I just have to say it... &amp;#34;Go case, so we met up with him here at Thirsty Bear. He is a beer enthusiast, so we had to get together at a brewery. We needed a place near his hotel in the FiDi that also served food, so this place fit the bill. <br&gt;<br&gt;Jimmy and Michael had beer, but I&amp;#39;m not a beer drinker so I had the Cava on the drinks menu. Our drinks came promptly, which were great, but our food came very late, at least 40 minutes after we ordered. Our server was nowhere to be found, so we had to wait a while to order more drinks and ask about our food&amp;#39;s ETA. I understand that it was Friday around 5 pm and they&amp;#39;re inundated by the after work crowd, but the food took too long. Our server did apologize for the backup in the kitchen, but I wish he had stopped by earlier to let us know.<br&gt;<br&gt;Jimmy ordered the Chorizo Flatbread and Michael ordered the ThirstyBurger. Both were happy with their food, but I was underwhelmed by my order of PEI Mussels in a Green Curry sauce. The mussels were really small and the green curry too mild. Very unsatisfying. I definitely did not order the right thing. The flatbread looked good. <br&gt;<br&gt;ThirstyBear is a huge place, so it&amp;#39;s great for big groups. If I were in the area thirsty for beer, I might go in but that&amp;#39;s all I&amp;#39;d have. I suppose because it is San Francisco City, they have to be fancy. Anyway, I digress. Let&amp;#39;s get straight to the beer. It is the first brewery certified as organic. Now, I am not sure how you feel about the word organic. I for one am not overly concerned as organic to me implies expensive. But, I also do not like to eat any GMO laced food items, so I was intrigued.<br&gt;I digress again!! Let&amp;#39;s talk beer. Delicious. Everything we drank was delicious. <br&gt;The food was, well, fancy San Francisco, so, and expensive. We shared the brussel sprouts appetizer, which was delicious. But due to the prices of the other items, which looked good coming out of the kitchen, we decided to limit our spending here. <br&gt;Come for the beer.
